physical_benefits.title: Enhanced Energy Levels
physical_benefits.description: Proper hydration helps maintain energy and reduces fatigue throughout the day
physical_benefits.detail: Even mild dehydration can significantly impact energy levels and cognitive function. Water helps increase circulation and ensures oxygen and nutrients reach your cells.

physical_benefits.title: Improved Cognitive Function
physical_benefits.description: Brain function depends on adequate hydration for concentration and memory
physical_benefits.detail: The brain is 75% water. Dehydration affects concentration, memory, and mood, leading to mental fog and poor decision-making.

physical_benefits.title: Better Digestion
physical_benefits.description: Water helps break down food and prevents digestive issues
physical_benefits.detail: Water helps soften stools, promotes regular bowel movements, and reduces risk of constipation and bloating.

physical_benefits.title: Cardiovascular Health
physical_benefits.description: Maintains proper blood volume and circulation
physical_benefits.detail: Hydration helps maintain proper blood volume and circulation, reducing strain on the heart and lowering risk of cardiovascular issues.

physical_benefits.title: Healthy Skin
physical_benefits.detail: Proper hydration helps maintain skin moisture balance, improving elasticity and reducing appearance of fine lines and wrinkles.

physical_benefits.title: Detoxification
physical_benefits.description: Helps remove toxins through kidneys and liver
physical_benefits.detail: Water supports natural detoxification processes, helping kidneys and liver filter out waste and toxins from the body.

daily_recommendations.men: 3.7 liters (125 ounces) total water intake daily
daily_recommendations.women: 2.7 liters (91 ounces) total water intake daily
daily_recommendations.elderly: May need more due to decreased thirst sensation

tips: Start your day with a glass of water to kickstart hydration
Carry a reusable water bottle to track intake
Eat water-rich foods like fruits and vegetables
Monitor urine color - light yellow indicates good hydration
Increase intake during exercise, hot weather, or illness
Filter or purify water if quality is questionable
Replace water filters according to manufacturer guidelines
